Package tests.sic.sST.poisson

tests.sic.sST.poisson package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run expected average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (s,S,T) facing Poisson distributed demands in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    FET2
    auxiliary class not part of the public API.
    Poisson2
    auxiliary class to make Poisson computations from the Colt library behave the same as in MATLAB, at least for the purposes needed in this package.
    ssPlusDTCpoissonBoxed
    the class works as the class sSTCnbinBoxed but the arguments are s, D (representing the difference S-s) and T, which allows for specifying the constraints 1 ≤ D ≤ Dmax directly on any meta-heuristic optimizing the function sSTCnbin.
    sSTCpoisson
    function implements the continuous-time long-run expected cost of a periodic review, single echelon inventory control system facing exogenous demands generated in a period of length T, from a Poisson process with parameter λ.
    sSTCpoissonBoxed
    the class extends the sSTCpoisson class with the functionality that it projects any argument for evaluation into the feasible region of the class.
    sSTCpoissonFastHeur2Opt
    class computes an approximate solution to the (s,S,T) policy optimization under Poisson demands, by computing near-optimal (r,nQ,T) policy parameters r*,Q*, and T* according to the heuristic implemented in class tests.sic.rnqt.poisson.RnQTCpoissonHeurPOpt and then computing the best (s(r*),S(r*+Q*)) parameters for t close to T* and picking the best parameters.
    sSTCpoissonFastHeurOpt
    class computes an approximate solution to the (s,S,T) policy optimization under Poisson demands, by computing near-optimal (r,nQ,T) policy parameters r*,Q*, and T* -which is usually done much faster- using the class tests.sic.rnqt.poisson.RnQTCpoisonHeurPOpt and then computing optimal (s(t),S(t)) parameters for t close to T* and picking the best set of parameters.
    sSTCpoissonFixedTBoxedConstrOpt
    class implements an optimizer over the first two variables of the (s,S,T) policy, namely the reorder point s and the order-up-to S variables, for given (fixed) review period T, subject to the constraints S ≥ s, s ∈ [smin, smax], and S ∈ [Smin, Smax], using an exhaustive search on both variables with step size εs.
    sSTCpoissonFixedTOpt
    class implements an optimizer over the first two variables of the (s,S,T) policy, namely the reorder point s and the order-up-to S variables, for given (fixed) review period T.
    sSTCpoissonFixedTOpterResult
    auxiliary class that is essentially just an immutable struct, holding 5 double values.
    sSTCpoissonFixedTOptTask
    auxiliary class encapsulating the notion of optimizing an sSTCpoisson function, with a fixed review period T.
    sSTCpoissonHeurOpt
    class computes an approximate solution to the (s,S,T) policy optimization under Poisson demands, by computing the optimal (r,nQ,T) policy parameters r*,Q*, and T* -which is usually done much faster- and then computing the optimal (s(t),S(t)) parameters for t close to T* and picking the best set of parameters.
    sSTCpoissonMetaHeurOpt
    class uses any of the following supported meta-heuristics for (s,S,T) policy optimization under Poisson demands: GA, SA, PS, DE, TS.
    sSTCpoissonOpt
    class implements an optimizer over ALL three variables of the (s,S,T) policy, namely the reorder point s, the order-up-to point S and the review period T.
    sSTCpoissonOptGraphD_T
    class graphs the optimal Δ*(T)=S(T)-s(T) for various T values for the (s,S,T) policy.
    sSTCpoissonSimpleHeurOpt
    class computes an approximate solution to the (s,S,T) policy optimization under Poisson demands by computing the optimal (r,nQ,T) policy parameters r*,Q*, and T* -which is usually done much faster- and then setting s*=r*, and S*=r*+Q*.
    sSTCRnQTCpoissonCompGraph_T
    class allows comparisons between the (s,S,T) and (r,nQ,T) policies by drawing graphs of the optimal (s,S,T) cost for the optimal values of s(T) and S(T) in the (s,S,T) policy for various T-values, and also drawing graphs of the same (s,S,T) policy, but for s=r(T) and S=r(T)+Q(T) where r(T) and Q(T) are the optimal values for r and Q of the (r,nQ,T) policy for given T.
    TestPoisson  

Package tests.sic.sST.poisson Description

tests.sic.sST.poisson package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run expected average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (s,S,T) facing Poisson distributed demands in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.

Package Specification

The formulae for the average cost of such a system are taken from the classic IE textbook of Hadley and Whitin, "Analysis of Inventory Systems", 1963.
